Articles.Content: I've been playing KSP since version 0.13, making the current version (1.1.3 my versionversary). I feel like I should bake a cake or something. When is your versionversary? Planning on doing anything special?

If I have to wait until 2.0.4 to enjoy a celebratory cake, I fear that some geriatric nurse will be serving it to me blended and through a straw. I'm going to celebrate 1.1.4 and call it a deciversary.

Edited July 10, 2016 by MachTurtle

Mine would be 1.2.0, given I started in .20

What I plan on doing special is retreating to my basement for insanely long hours of KSP, as I do with every big update.

Edited July 9, 2016 by nosirrbro
I joined at 0.14 but the demo was 0.13 heh. I've played more of KSP than any other game...
Well, mine's going to be at 1.9.0. I've got a while to go...
How do you tell?  I don't think I saved the earliest update.  Maybe some sort of stream log mentions the data and you have to compare against Squad's timeline?
1.2.3. 0.23 is when I started.

5 hours ago, Mjp1050 said:

Well, mine's going to be at 1.9.0. I've got a while to go...

That's close to me, as I installed the game at .25, but by the time the game finished installing I needed to update the game to .90  (so much for high speed dialup)
1.19.1 for me. March 2013 - seems like yesterday!
I dunno when I started. I started the summer after Duncan of the Yogscast did a playthrough, so whenever that was.
Mine would be 1.19.1.

11 hours ago, The_Rocketeer said:

1.19.1 for me. March 2013 - seems like yesterday!

Same. I remember I had downloaded an earlier demo version maybe a year before and wasn't captivated. But when it arrived on Steam with 0.19.1 and was on sale to celebrate the occasion, I decided to give it a try for real. Almost 40 months later and I have to now force myself to step away for a couple months at a time periodically ...
1.9.0 or 2.0.5. Since I got it for Christmas off the KSP store (at 0.90), I had to buy it again off Steam at 1.0.5 for it to update.

I began with 0.8.1 i think, so my versionversary was back in 0.18 (the update where they added planets!) Edit: planets were in 0.17. My second versionversary will be 1.8!

Edited July 10, 2016 by Willbl3pic

Well, we need 1.2 first. Then, a first hotfix, 1.2.1.  Then the hotfix to fix the hotfix, 1.2.2. Then, finally, after the devs take a vacation for a week, my version-versary of 1.2.3 will happen, when the lingering bugs that were to have have been fixed in/were introduced by 1.2.1 and 1.2.2 are finally replaced with brand new, up-to-date lingering bugs to be fixed and replaced with better bugs in 1.3.

So yeah, 0.23 was when I started.  And I know the above sounds a bit cynical, but it's the truth of any large software project, particularly one with the characteristics of KSP. Heck, when I started:

  • The air was a thick mess that needed 4500 m/s to push though, and the lovely 90 degree at 10-km "gravity turn" to get to orbit.
  • Fins were unneeded, too.
  • There were no Gizmos - don't want that part surface-mounted? Too bad.
  • There were no fairings, but that was OK, because there wasn't any atmospheric heating or proper drag calculations to protect against.
  • Because of this, nose cones were useless.
  • There was no use for money, Career mode was still new and what we today call "science mode".
  • The only bodies with more than one surface biome were Kerbin and the Mun. (Maybe Minmus too? I forget. :p)
  • Size-3 parts were just introduced and everybody was still making mainsail-based asparagus launchers.
  • Load times were longer and crashes were much more common.

Nice to see how far the game's come since then!

Edited July 11, 2016 by moogoob
90, 45, whatevah!

50 minutes ago, Willbl3pic said:

I began with 0.8.1 i think, so my versionversary was back in 0.18 (the update where they added planets!). My second versionversary will be 1.8!

Didn't they add planets in 0.17?

My demoversary is 1.8.3 and my versionversary is 1.2.1 (from 0.21).

However, I switched FROM steam to the KSP store when it wouldn't update to .24 or .25 (can't figure out which one by the date because I have since used it for the 1.1 prerelease), so in that case it is not until 1.2.4 or 1.2.5.

Anyone from 0.11.3 who gets to celebrate their semi-versionversary?

52 minutes ago, Willbl3pic said:

I began with 0.8.1 i think, so my versionversary was back in 0.18 (the update where they added planets!). My second versionversary will be 1.8!

Planets were added in 0.17.

btw dude congrats on staying so long.

My demoversary is 1.8.3 and my versionversary is 1.2.1 (from 0.21).

However, I switched FROM steam to the KSP store when it wouldn't update to .24 or .25 (can't figure out which one by the date because I have since used it for the 1.1 prerelease), so in that case it is not until 1.2.4 or 1.2.5.

Anyone from 0.11.3 who gets to celebrate their semi-versionversary?

fixed.

3 minutes ago, HoloYolo said:

Planets were added in 0.17.

btw dude congrats on staying so long.

fixed.

and thanks

On 7/9/2016 at 10:00 AM, teacherboi said:

I've been playing KSP since version 0.13, making the current version (1.1.3 my versionversary).

How does that work?  Shouldn't it be version 1.13.x?
Darn. I need to wait for 1.9.
OK, did some scrounging around, and I think I joined just when 0.21 came out. So my version-versary is coming up soon

Found, played, and reached space (after ten different rocket iterations) in 0.9. So... 0.90 was already there, then, 1.9? 9.0? Yeah, problem with version naming system is that you can't really say which one is kinda anniversary of one from the past. Should it be by every .1? .10? 1.0? 10.0?  I'm getting really confused here.
I doubt this will last as long as 1.9.0, seeing I started when it was 0.90
